commit_message:
Document installing the undercloud with SSL endpoints

Adds a new admonition that covers how to install the undercloud
with ssl endpoints.  I would anticipate the admonition being
reused for the overcloud when that is documented.

Also covers how to generate a self-signed certificate appropriate
for use with HAProxy.

Change-Id: Iec58f79b83db6cbb684ff309b818d1a8f437dfa1

commit_message:
Enable loadbalancer with ssl on undercloud

When an ssl certificate is configured, configures haproxy with said
certificate in front of the public API endpoints for the services.
If no certificate is configured, leaves everything setup as before.

Change-Id: Idd9492303e797f5b39c980772f33754fb44a9f12

commit_message:
Gen the image dependency in the Graphviz dot format

By using

    ./tools/build.py --save-dependency a.dot

to gen the Graphviz dot dependency file. Later, you can use the `dot`
to draw the picture.

    dot -Tjpg -o a.jpg a.dot

Implements: blueprint images-dependency-tree
Depends-On: I8e07a1b69fab5f1c587470bfd2104aaba93f0050
Change-Id: If00f4f3fb9d0b10a07ab2abb7ffb1cd9d64902f2

subject: [WIP] Add the neutron-classifier project
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-13 17:54:18.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': '[WIP] Add the neutron-classifier project

Neutron currently has a number of packet classifiers sprinkled
throughout the main repo and sub-projects. For example, there is traffic
classification in the Quality of Service API extension, the Security
Group API extension, the LBaas API extension, the FwaaS extension, the
Service Function chaining project, to list just a few.

Many of these projects have created their own data models to classify
network traffic, and most are classifying the same attributes of a
TCP/IP packet. Instead of having multiple implementations, a new library
can be developed that can be consumed by any project that wishes to do
traffic classification.

Change-Id: I97778f7ea6e8151602cf44c1523f14e2b4a98767'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Add the neutron-classifier project

Neutron currently has a number of packet classifiers sprinkled
throughout the main repo and sub-projects. For example, there is traffic
classification in the Quality of Service API extension, the Security
Group API extension, the LBaas API extension, the FwaaS extension, the
Service Function chaining project, to list just a few.

Many of these projects have created their own data models to classify
network traffic, and most are classifying the same attributes of a
TCP/IP packet. Instead of having multiple implementations, a new library
can be developed that can be consumed by any project that wishes to do
traffic classification.

Change-Id: I97778f7ea6e8151602cf44c1523f14e2b4a98767

commit_message:
Use separate queue for agent state reports.

This optimization is needed for big clusters with hundreds
of agents where the spike of activity may trigger a burst
of RPC requests that would prevent neutron-server from processing
agent heart beats in time, triggering resource rescheduling.

This will be further optimized by running dedicated RPC workers
for state reports processing.

Related-Bug: #1496410
(cherry picked from commit 7267d75fdd3f90af759d71e9490cd41d41ba6d98)

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py
	neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py

Change-Id: Id86a1f962aaa4f64011d57ae55d240f890cca4f7

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: I9a99477f3f41884e86c984ffde9f46498953e933
Closes-Bug: #1530742

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-31 15:30:21.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/061_add_snapshot_id_timestamp_to_backups.py'], 'message': "Fix race conditions in migration 061

Migration 061 is supposed to add new `data_timestamp` field and populate
it with value of `created_at` column. This was done by selecting all the
backups and doing updates one-by-one. As it wasn't done in transaction
solution was prone to race condition when a new backup is added while
running the migration. This means that this migration could cause
problems when running in live environment. With blueprint
online-schema-upgrades we want to make Cinder able to perform migrations
live.

A solution is to change this statement to a single DB query which
updates all the rows. This commit also removes unnecessary update to
snapshot_id added there. As this column is nullable it will by default
be NULL, so there's no need to set it manually to that value.

As before and after this commit the migration does logically the same,
this should be safe even if someone is doing inter-release deployments.

An alternative would be to simply add transaction to the update step in
the migration, but that would effectively lock the table for longer
period of time than atomic one-query update.

Closes-Bug: 1530358
Change-Id: Ib8733c096a3dbe2bad00beaf5734936ffcddda33
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race conditions in migration 061

Migration 061 is supposed to add new `data_timestamp` field and populate
it with value of `created_at` column. This was done by selecting all the
backups and doing updates one-by-one. As it wasn't done in transaction
solution was prone to race condition when a new backup is added while
running the migration. This means that this migration could cause
problems when running in live environment. With blueprint
online-schema-upgrades we want to make Cinder able to perform migrations
live.

A solution is to change this statement to a single DB query which
updates all the rows. This commit also removes unnecessary update to
snapshot_id added there. As this column is nullable it will by default
be NULL, so there's no need to set it manually to that value.

As before and after this commit the migration does logically the same,
this should be safe even if someone is doing inter-release deployments.

An alternative would be to simply add transaction to the update step in
the migration, but that would effectively lock the table for longer
period of time than atomic one-query update.

Closes-Bug: 1530358
Change-Id: Ib8733c096a3dbe2bad00beaf5734936ffcddda33

commit_message:
Update README to reflect pod model migration

One AZ(availability zone) can have multiple pods, but one pod will
belong to only one AZ. Tricircle will serve as the OpenStack API
gateway to bottom pods.

BP: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tricircle/+spec/implement-stateless

Change-Id: Ie7fc4faaa5ae4ca7c0e0153e993ea3f9f0cc252b
Signed-off-by: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Replace assertEqual(arg, None) with assertIsNone(arg)

In python-swiftclient some test cases using asserEqual(arg, None)
instead of assertIsNone(arg).assertIsNone method provides clear error message.

Closes-Bug: #1527556

commit_message:
[WIP] Convert AIO bootstrap from bash to Ansible

This patch converts the AIO bootstrap process to use Ansible
instead of bash scripting. The patch also minimises the options
available to focus the role concerned to just handle an AIO
bootstrap, but gives it just enough flexibility to allow the
deployer to specify a secondary disk for the AIO to consume.

A major change is that the AIO bootstrap process no longer
assumes that it can destroy a secondary boot device. It
requires a device name to be provided. This prevents horrible
surprises.

TODO (in subsequent patches):
 - update the RPC docs
 - convert run-playbooks.sh into an Ansible playbook

UpgradeImpact:
 - Ansible has been updated to v1.9.4-1
 - Secrets have moved out from user_variables.yml into
   user_secrets.yml

Backport Note:
While this backport respects the differences between the Master
branch and the Juno branch, it also brings all the gating and
AIO related scripts into line with each other to ensure that all
methods and settings (where applicable) are the same.

The following differences from the Master patch are noted:
 - neutron_rpc_workers must be 0 for Juno
 - the in-tree pip_install role is used (configured in
   tests/ansible.cfg) instead of the new independent role
 - Change I98bcb478e99e11956618b2327399e18471aab534 is included
 - Change I31f63a2998080c6fedab3af7c2b1bb1a987d8c08 is included
 - Change If3a914650749d72c2eb13b9f1307ef7b4319bd2f is included
 - All references to Ceilometer & Aodh have been removed
 - All references to MongoDB have been removed
 - In Juno there is no env.d directory, so all tasks related to
   it have been removed

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh
>------scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh
>------scripts/gate-check-commit.sh
>------scripts/scripts-library.sh

Implements: blueprint convert-aio-bootstrap-to-ansible
Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: I6028952e7260388873f57db47cc3e08126ecc530
(cherry picked from commit 892c7fe46c68bc36e76f21a6b699349167534f46)

subject: Correct SecurityError with unicode args
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 13478, 'name': 'Boris Bobrov', 'email': 'b.bobrov@sap.com', 'username': 'bbobrov'}, {'_account_id': 16523, 'name': 'ZhangLei', 'display_name': 'ZhangLei', 'email': 'zhang.lei@99cloud.net', 'username': 'zhang.lei'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-22 15:07:01.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/exception.py'], 'message': "Correct SecurityError with unicode args

_build_message() in the Error class has a bunch of code to handle
UnicodeDecodeError when doing message formatting. SecurityError
is a subclass of Error and overrides _build_message() but wasn't
handling UnicodeDecodeError. SecurityError's _build_message()
should work the same way as Error's.

Change-Id: I1ba1f1a1f3a211e805260817ba76f9e7bb6c0c4c
"}]
commit_message:
Correct SecurityError with unicode args

_build_message() in the Error class has a bunch of code to handle
UnicodeDecodeError when doing message formatting. SecurityError
is a subclass of Error and overrides _build_message() but wasn't
handling UnicodeDecodeError. SecurityError's _build_message()
should work the same way as Error's.

oslo.log's "debug" option was co-opted to also indicate that the
responses should include more information. A separate config
option should be used instead so that deployers don't mistakenly
expose themselves to security issues.

The debug option still is used for what it does in oslo.log and
how it works on all other projects -- if you're not using a log

commit_message:
Config option for insecure responses

oslo.log's "debug" option was co-opted to also indicate that the
responses should include more information. A separate config
option should be used instead so that deployers don't mistakenly
expose themselves to security issues.

The debug option still is used for what it does in oslo.log and
how it works on all other projects -- if you're not using a log
config file it sets the base logger to debug.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Icf8dd2f0b88abc89092d487bbcefb525960c4ec6
Closes-Bug: 1479523

commit_message:
Align template defaults with the client

This aligns the parameter default values from python-tripleoclient
with tripleo-heat-templates. This is in preparation for removing
all the defaults from the client, and maintaining them only in the
templates.

Change-Id: I7b635a250f1ecc170e18d8e434f0118c6fcbb942
Co-Authored-By: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-06 00:04:13.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/tripleo.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'zuul/layout: disable puppet-tuskar jobs

puppet-tuskar is not supported anymore in master, because TripleO team
decided to give up Tuskar for some reasons.
Puppet groups wants to stop maintaining master while we will maintain
stable/* branches if needed.

This patch create noop jobs so we can still merge patches in stable
branches if needed.

Change-Id: I1238a5a16aaf376277a7fbebc027d42fc106d100
'}]
commit_message:
zuul/layout: disable puppet-tuskar jobs

puppet-tuskar is not supported anymore in master, because TripleO team
decided to give up Tuskar for some reasons.
Puppet groups wants to stop maintaining master while we will maintain
stable/* branches if needed.

This patch create noop jobs so we can still merge patches in stable
branches if needed.

Change-Id: I1238a5a16aaf376277a7fbebc027d42fc106d100

'}]
commit_message:
net-bagpipe: remove now unneeded -liberty jobs

This change removes the -liberty jobs for networking-bgpvpn.

These are now un-needed since our master targets the openstack master
for mitaka, and we now have a specific stable/liberty branch targetting
liberty.

Change-Id: Ia9c009147fe5e22c9f5b48c311e83638a898e108

commit_message:
Remove useless Meta-Action

Some Python class and packages need to be renamed
for a better compliance with the shared terminology
which provides a better understanding of Watcher objects
and components by every contributor.

Partially implements: blueprint glossary-related-refactoring

commit_message:
Align parameter defaults with the python tripleo client defaults

This aligns the tripleo-heat-template parameter default values with
those used by the python tripleoclient at
https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/blob/master/tripleoclient/constants.py
python-rdomanager-oscplugin with tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: I3cdb088e35c3dbceb11153134d9c0992083a7465
Closes-Bug: 1529800

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-05 12:08:02.000000000', 'files': ['pkg/elasticsearch.sh', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'files/rpms/general', 'tools/fixup_stuff.sh', 'lib/ceph', 'files/rpms/nova', 'stack.sh'], 'message': "Remove support for Fedora 21 (EOL); add F22 where appropriate

Fedora 21 reached its End Of Life (EOL) on 1-DEC-2015[1]; remove it as
supported distribution.

    - stack.sh: Remove Fedora 21 from list of supported distributions.
    - tools/fixup_stuff.sh: Make the minimum Fedora version to be F22 in
      from a conditional check in 'Python packages' section
    - files/rpms/general: Remove 'f21' from NOPRIME.
    - lib/ceph: Remove 'f21' from the check_os_support_ceph() function.
    - doc/source/index.rst: s/Fedora 21/Fedora 22/
    - pkg/elasticsearch.sh: Remove the 'if' conditional in the
      install_elasticsearch() function.

[1] https://fedoramagazine.org/fedora-21-end-life-december-1st/

Change-Id: Ifbcc3dd783ff2f362a464fbf4ca22f20cc2c658e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove support for Fedora 21 (EOL); add F22 where appropriate

Fedora 21 reached its End Of Life (EOL) on 1-DEC-2015[1]; remove it as
supported distribution.

    - stack.sh: Remove Fedora 21 from list of supported distributions.
    - tools/fixup_stuff.sh: Make the minimum Fedora version to be F22 in
      from a conditional check in 'Python packages' section
    - files/rpms/general: Remove 'f21' from NOPRIME.
    - lib/ceph: Remove 'f21' from the check_os_support_ceph() function.
    - doc/source/index.rst: s/Fedora 21/Fedora 22/
    - pkg/elasticsearch.sh: Remove the 'if' conditional in the
      install_elasticsearch() function.

[1] https://fedoramagazine.org/fedora-21-end-life-december-1st/

Change-Id: Ifbcc3dd783ff2f362a464fbf4ca22f20cc2c658e

subject: Put py34 first in the env order of tox
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-06 08:01:12.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then,
run py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to
avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Iee3333b401877a310cb39332f8dfe474c2b614ea
Closes-bug: #1489059
'}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then,
run py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to
avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Iee3333b401877a310cb39332f8dfe474c2b614ea
Closes-bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Wrong usage of "a"

Wrong usage of "a" in the mesages:
"This condition is to test for a entry"
"Creating a image"
"Waits for a interface to reach a given status."

Should be:
"This condition is to test for an entry"
"Creating an image"
"Waits for an interface to reach a given status."

Totally 3 occasions in Tempest base code.

Change-Id: I7c84ea3477bc02006a881981db77fdcf1f61a935

subject: WIP: Enable terminology translation and comment
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-17 10:23:59.000000000', 'files': ['doc/locale/contributing.pot', 'doc/locale/official_translator.pot', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/locale/bug_report.pot', 'doc/locale/index.pot', 'doc/locale/terminology.pot', 'doc/locale/handling_bugs.pot', 'doc/locale/create_lang_team.pot', 'tox.ini', 'doc/source/terminology.rst'], 'message': 'WIP: Enable terminology translation and comment

This is a sample to show the terminologies format.

doc/source/terminology.rst is a sample of terminologies.
You could see the terms and the comments.
(Comments are in Japanese now, we should translate them into English in
the final version.)
By running tox -e pot, pot files will be generated in doc/locale folder.
Please notice the comments are not included in the terminology.pot.

You could run tox -e docs to see the generated HTML file.

If we agree with the format, more actions need to be taken:
Enable the auto translation of i18n repo
Translators translate terminology.pot
Manually pack terminology.pot and its translation po files
and upload to Zanata ( the first msgid in terminlogy.pot should be removed
before uploading )

Change-Id: I6e66040f189b2d92a8c235a4fcb45dcc1592a854
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Enable terminology translation and comment

This is a sample to show the terminologies format.

doc/source/terminology.rst is a sample of terminologies.
You could see the terms and the comments.
(Comments are in Japanese now, we should translate them into English in
the final version.)
By running tox -e pot, pot files will be generated in doc/locale folder.
Please notice the comments are not included in the terminology.pot.

You could run tox -e docs to see the generated HTML file.

If we agree with the format, more actions need to be taken:
Enable the auto translation of i18n repo
Translators translate terminology.pot
Manually pack terminology.pot and its translation po files
and upload to Zanata ( the first msgid in terminlogy.pot should be removed
before uploading )

Change-Id: I6e66040f189b2d92a8c235a4fcb45dcc1592a854

commit_message:
Do not use __builtin__ in python3

__builtin__ does not exist in Python 3, use
six.moves.builtins instead.

Change-Id: Idcaa582190fbb655f7e3e965a3a165137bdd9e3c
Closes-Bug: #1290234

commit_message:
[Reports] Add charts classes for new output format

There are a set of classes added that will be in use
in further patches to process output data in new format.

These classes are:
  * OutputChart - base class for output-related charts
  * OutputStackedAreaChart - data is shown as Stacked Area
  * OutputAvgChart - average values shown as Pie
  * OutputStatsTable - makes generic statistics table

Existent class OutputStackedAreaChart is renamed
to OutputStackedAreaDeprecatedChart to avoid name conflict
with new class. Proper NOTE is added.

Also proporty Table.COLUMNS is renamed to lowercase.

Change-Id: I5cc4f34502fe308b775fdefa5d1bd90131b4d26b
Implements: spec improve_scenario_output_format.rst

revisions:

When deploy devstack multiple times, it throws such an exception:

mkdir /opt/stack/nanomsg
mkdir: cannot create directory '/opt/stack/nanomsg': File exists

We check if the directory exists first.

Change-Id: I8b30657e397776588c28b6a2d394ad21c1b29b53
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unable to create directory for nanomsg

When deploy devstack multiple times, it throws such an exception:

mkdir /opt/stack/nanomsg
mkdir: cannot create directory '/opt/stack/nanomsg': File exists

We check if the directory exists first.

Change-Id: I8b30657e397776588c28b6a2d394ad21c1b29b53

commit_message:
Remove the horrible catch-all during consumption

It is finally safe to remove the horrible catch-all logic during host
state consumption because all kinds of consumptions are correctly
handled :)

The final step will be make claim code reusable to remove all the
those duplicated claims in HostState.

Change-Id: I8a408a5e223d65a8f804749884055351f49bd766
Partially-Implements: bp host-state-level-locking

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-02 05:19:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': 'Claim pci in scheduler host state

Modify HostState.consume_from_instance to claim pci and check whether it
is consumable in the selected host. The related exception will be raised
with reasons. Scheduler can thus detect whether the pci request will
potentially trigger retry in the compute node, and prevent this from
happening to avoid the according expensive retry.

Note that this implementation is not the same with claim code in compute
service, because HostState.pci_stats does not track device objects. But
the claim logic is similar using `PciDeviceStats.support_requests` to
test resources. The following refactoring work can thus be easier.

Change-Id: Ifb91b29531d30bb4010b9064177e35e56e1e8584
Partially-Implements: bp host-state-level-locking
'}]
commit_message:
Claim pci in scheduler host state

Modify HostState.consume_from_instance to claim pci and check whether it
is consumable in the selected host. The related exception will be raised
with reasons. Scheduler can thus detect whether the pci request will
potentially trigger retry in the compute node, and prevent this from
happening to avoid the according expensive retry.

Note that this implementation is not the same with claim code in compute
service, because HostState.pci_stats does not track device objects. But
the claim logic is similar using `PciDeviceStats.support_requests` to
test resources. The following refactoring work can thus be easier.

Change-Id: Ifb91b29531d30bb4010b9064177e35e56e1e8584
Partially-Implements: bp host-state-level-locking

will be raised with reasons. Scheduler can thus detect whether the
request's numa topology will potentially trigger retry in the compute
node, and prevent this from happening to avoid the according expensive
retry.

Note that this implementation is based on claim logic in compute
service. The code looks similar so that the following refactoring work
can be easier. And there will be another patch to implement pci claim.

Change-Id: I31513ef328a7e4f22ce9345576ef7f325de9c8b9
Partially-Implements: bp host-state-level-locking
"}]
commit_message:
Claim numa topology in scheduler host state

Modify HostState.consume_from_instance to claim numa topology and check
whether it is consumable in the selected host. The related exception
will be raised with reasons. Scheduler can thus detect whether the
request's numa topology will potentially trigger retry in the compute
node, and prevent this from happening to avoid the according expensive
retry.

Note that this implementation is based on claim logic in compute
service. The code looks similar so that the following refactoring work
can be easier. And there will be another patch to implement pci claim.

Change-Id: I31513ef328a7e4f22ce9345576ef7f325de9c8b9
Partially-Implements: bp host-state-level-locking

and CachedScheduler because of more accurate host state caches.

commit_message:
Handle claim failure in FilterScheduler._schedule

This change ensures that no resources are consumed in the host state if
any of the claims in `HostState.consume_from_request()` fails, and the
scheduler will change to try the second best host. This process is
identical to the claim logic in the compute nodes, so that some host
failing conditions in the compute nodes can be detected as soon as
possible to prevent some expensive retries. Note that the previous
implemented locks have already guaranteed that host states will not be
contaminated by concurrent host state updates amoung green threads.
Those locks will improve the scheduler decisions both in FilterScheduler
and CachedScheduler because of more accurate host state caches.

The following patches will implement the claims for pci and numa
resources and merge compute node claim logics if possible.

Change-Id: I3759233a56d28f7153ee8c2f00a60ad22fe94e78
Partially-implements: blueprint host-state-level-locking

commit_message:
Claim cpu ram and disk in scheduler host state

Modify HostState.consume_from_instance to check cpu, ram and disk
resouces using the identical logic with `nova.compute.claims.Claim`
If the resources are not enough, the related exception will be raised
with detailed reasons. Together with previous implemented host state
locks, the scheduler can detect potential retries as soon as possible.

The following patches will implement ComputeResourcesUnavailable
handling to do retries inside scheduler, and to claim pci and numa
resources.

Change-Id: I7f80dc0dc9e30d801300f1e71b84bea5d3c09bc6
Partially-Implements: bp host-state-level-locking

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6951, 'name': 'Brandon Logan', 'email': 'brandon.logan@rackspace.com', 'username': 'brandon-logan'}, {'_account_id': 8157, 'name': 'Bertrand LALLAU', 'email': 'bertrand.lallau@gmail.com', 'username': 'blallau'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 10850, 'name': 'German Eichberger', 'email': 'german.eichberger@gmail.com', 'username': 'german'}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-06 02:16:04.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/amphorae/drivers/keepalived/jinja/test_jinja_cfg.py', 'octavia/amphorae/drivers/keepalived/jinja/templates/keepalived_base.template'], 'message': 'Add nopreempt support for active/standby

This patch enables nopreempt for active/standby topology amphora.
This reduces the need to migrate the IP between the active and standby
amphora.  This is important for amphora that are using TLS offload.

When a MASTER amphora fails over to a BACKUP amphora the IP address
migrates to the BACKUP which becomes the new MASTER.
With this patch, should the original MASTER come back up, the IP will not
migrate back to the original MASTER until the BACKUP fails.
Current behavior is when the original MASTER comes back up the IP
will migrate back to it.

Change-Id: Ib9f5ecd92f37299c7ae5cbb607f4f9df9106409f
'}]
commit_message:
Add nopreempt support for active/standby

This patch enables nopreempt for active/standby topology amphora.
This reduces the need to migrate the IP between the active and standby
amphora.  This is important for amphora that are using TLS offload.

When a MASTER amphora fails over to a BACKUP amphora the IP address
migrates to the BACKUP which becomes the new MASTER.
With this patch, should the original MASTER come back up, the IP will not
migrate back to the original MASTER until the BACKUP fails.
Current behavior is when the original MASTER comes back up the IP
will migrate back to it.

Change-Id: Ib9f5ecd92f37299c7ae5cbb607f4f9df9106409f

remove unused update_dhcp_hostfile_with_text method

This method isn't used anywhere in the code. Having dead code in tree
makes it much harder to debug issues because there are so many garden
paths to wander down.

Change-Id: I1bda8c75c6f54ad01c2d39106798a9c828595862

commit_message:
Implements base classes for functional tests

In the cross project workshop "Establishing key themes for the Mitaka
cycle" [1] during the Mitaka summit, one of the agreed point was to
implement functional tests for the client libraries. [2]

Later on, this will serve to improve our backward compatibility for
client libraries. See I72e4e9cfa0539f6b326a0296c065fa3cb754f8ae

In preparation to implement the functional tests for both v2 and v3
clients, this patch initializes the new directories and adds the base
test classes: V3ClientTestCase and V2ClientTestCase.

Each class instantiates its specific keystoneclient version via
os-client-config either based on a clouds.yaml config file or from the
environment variables.

[1] https://mitakadesignsummit.sched.org/event/edd78ade4c7c92581a7cabc26019a85a
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/mitaka-crossproject-themes

Change-Id: Ia73d72d5f87051fb46d733782275b548874a1def

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-08 02:42:13.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "add graphviz library

The project kolla needs graphviz to generate the image dependency
tree.[0]

Is the library actively maintained?
===================================
Yes. It is a active project on github[1]. And the latest release at
Nov 13, 2015[2].

Is the library good code?
=========================
It's mostly covered by unit tests and PEP8 compatible.

Is the library python 3 compatible?
===================================
Yes. It is compatible with python2.6, python2.7, python3.3, python3.4
and python3.5.

Is the library license compatible?
==================================
Yes, it's licensed under MIT.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
=========================================================
No. But it is easy to package.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries?
===================================================================
No, there is no library interacting with Graphviz in global requirements.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252929/
[1] https://github.com/xflr6/graphviz
[2] https://github.com/xflr6/graphviz/releases/tag/0.4.8

Change-Id: I8e07a1b69fab5f1c587470bfd2104aaba93f0050
"}]
commit_message:
add graphviz library

The project kolla needs graphviz to generate the image dependency
tree.[0]

Is the library actively maintained?
===================================
Yes. It is a active project on github[1]. And the latest release at
Nov 13, 2015[2].

Is the library good code?
=========================
It's mostly covered by unit tests and PEP8 compatible.

Is the library python 3 compatible?
===================================
Yes. It is compatible with python2.6, python2.7, python3.3, python3.4
and python3.5.

Is the library license compatible?
==================================
Yes, it's licensed under MIT.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
=========================================================
No. But it is easy to package.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries?
===================================================================
No, there is no library interacting with Graphviz in global requirements.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252929/
[1] https://github.com/xflr6/graphviz
[2] https://github.com/xflr6/graphviz/releases/tag/0.4.8

Change-Id: I8e07a1b69fab5f1c587470bfd2104aaba93f0050

commit_message:
libvirt: fix typo in test_init_host_migration_flags

VIR_MIGRATE_TUNNELLEDVIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC is not a valid flag.

Note - fixing this doesn't actually affect the test because we don't
parse the value in init_host(), we just check whether it contains the
VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC string.

Change-Id: If33c63c0c7a3397c2b80714049b509c5918bfdc2
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-23 07:15:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py'], 'message': 'Remove name_id when creating volume with cache enabled

When image_volume_cache_enabled = True, Cinder will create
a cached image volume. But when creating this image volume,
the name_id is set to id of newly created volume, which causes
the image volume is unable to be created in the underlying storage
system.

This fix will remove the name_id so that volume.name can refer to
correct LUN on storage system

Also, a minor fix: passing volume.id to delete_volume since
it only accept volume id.

Change-Id: Ib47b189a525d8a9bd9026cc20f62542aede9c9d4
Closes-bug: 1528087
'}]
commit_message:
Remove name_id when creating volume with cache enabled

When image_volume_cache_enabled = True, Cinder will create
a cached image volume. But when creating this image volume,
the name_id is set to id of newly created volume, which causes
the image volume is unable to be created in the underlying storage
system.

This fix will remove the name_id so that volume.name can refer to
correct LUN on storage system

Also, a minor fix: passing volume.id to delete_volume since
it only accept volume id.

Change-Id: Ib47b189a525d8a9bd9026cc20f62542aede9c9d4
Closes-bug: 1528087

commit_message:
Delete test_restart_l3_agent_on_sighup

After looking at the test and its scope, it seems like 100% of the
code it tests is owned by oslo.service. That library has its own tests,
is there value in keeping the test in Neutron?

Change-Id: I0d8a22cc8127e183c1f55790f4b04dea2d30d356

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: Ica2deb048cc6afc7acd4ffdc0fa521e23b079942
Closes-Bug: #1530742

commit_message:
vNIC tagging

A cloud user boots a VM with two network interfaces. One is connected
to a private network, the other to the public Internet. There is
currently no direct way to tell which interface is which. This patch
proposes an optional virtual network interface tag that is set by the
user at boot time and is exposed in the metadata.

APIImpact

Implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging
Change-Id: I053ed08198ca80d70bf5d37313eb848e78395ccc

commit_message:
Set cluster to correct status when scaling failed

Currently, cluster status will not be set to correct value when
resizing/scaling action failed for size limitation check failure.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I9de9a8684c8aa6ffeae9b5f7df9331e51eb168b3
Closes-Bug: #1530746

'name': 'Brandon Palm', 'email': 'bapalm@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'bapalm'}, {'_account_id': 18051, 'name': 'David Shaughnessy', 'email': 'david.shaughnessy@intel.com', 'username': 'davidsha'}, revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-12-28 16:06:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/test_server.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/test_service.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': "SIGHUP missed by child daemon process

This issue might be due to the service process missing the
SIGHUP. This is reproducible locally when we set 'max pending
signals' of the shell using ulimit to a low value, like 10.
`ulimit -i 10`
and running test_restart_l3_agent_on_sighup 30 times or so.

This patch will test the runs and check the success rate for
'test_restart_l3_agent_on_sighup' on the server which fails
intermittently. This issue will happen when there is heavy
load on the server due to which
1) pending signals threshold may be hit
2) neutron-l3-agent service takes a long while to start

This patch introduces a fix to check start of the server by
using a simple temp file based sync. This will remove the
static delay, and the timeout is kept to 60 sec max for the
l3 service to start. The call to 'ulimit -i unlimited' is
removed. I've verified the runs locally by setting it to
unlimited for the shell and concurrent runs of
test_restart_l3_agent_on_sighup.

If the test passes consistently, then the ulimit of
'max pending signals' of the server has to be set to
'unlimited' permanently in the configuration, and the patch
can be reviewed as it now removes all static delays.
The tests may still fail under very heavy load, this
will test whether the rate of failures is reduced.

Change-Id: I10355057f1c539cc8dd688fe7874055ae8d8c795
Closes-Bug: #1518921
"}]
commit_message:
SIGHUP missed by child daemon process

This issue might be due to the service process missing the
SIGHUP. This is reproducible locally when we set 'max pending
signals' of the shell using ulimit to a low value, like 10.
`ulimit -i 10`
and running test_restart_l3_agent_on_sighup 30 times or so.

This patch will test the runs and check the success rate for
'test_restart_l3_agent_on_sighup' on the server which fails
intermittently. This issue will happen when there is heavy
load on the server due to which
1) pending signals threshold may be hit
2) neutron-l3-agent service takes a long while to start

This patch introduces a fix to check start of the server by
using a simple temp file based sync. This will remove the
static delay, and the timeout is kept to 60 sec max for the
l3 service to start. The call to 'ulimit -i unlimited' is
removed. I've verified the runs locally by setting it to
unlimited for the shell and concurrent runs of
test_restart_l3_agent_on_sighup.

If the test passes consistently, then the ulimit of
'max pending signals' of the server has to be set to
'unlimited' permanently in the configuration, and the patch
can be reviewed as it now removes all static delays.
The tests may still fail under very heavy load, this
will test whether the rate of failures is reduced.

Change-Id: I10355057f1c539cc8dd688fe7874055ae8d8c795
Closes-Bug: #1518921

performance, This commit explains what we should consider to
get better scheduling performance.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-05 17:07:02.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': 'Use qemu everywhere

OVH supports nested virt and by default devstack will use it.
Since we have seen some problems on OVH only that may be related
to nested virt, specify that qemu should be used by default so
that we may see if it eliminates the problem.

Change-Id: I37e789f6e14e4cb1bcac17fcf0e4028cb3d520d8
Related-Bug: 1531155
'}]
commit_message:
Use qemu everywhere

OVH supports nested virt and by default devstack will use it.
Since we have seen some problems on OVH only that may be related
to nested virt, specify that qemu should be used by default so
that we may see if it eliminates the problem.

Change-Id: I37e789f6e14e4cb1bcac17fcf0e4028cb3d520d8
Related-Bug: 1531155

While waiting for VMs to go ACTIVE during the create cluster flow,
if one or more VMs go into ERROR state the VM check task continues
until it times out. If one or more VM(s) go into ERROR state, the flow

Change-Id: I9e3768c5a55803afe05f75fad41ecf74471b4694
Closes-Bug: 1522633
'}]
commit_message:
Abort VM Status flow when VM(s) go to ERROR state

While waiting for VMs to go ACTIVE during the create cluster flow,
if one or more VMs go into ERROR state the VM check task continues
until it times out. If one or more VM(s) go into ERROR state, the flow
should be abort instead of waiting for that VM to go into ACTIVE state.

Change-Id: I9e3768c5a55803afe05f75fad41ecf74471b4694
Closes-Bug: 1522633

subject: Fix H405 violations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-04 03:18:13.000000000', 'files': ['magnum_ui/api/magnum.py', 'magnum_ui/api/rest/magnum.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix H405 violations

There are a lot of H405 violation codes.
We need to fix the code for avoiding more violations.

Change-Id: I0db7b2276126f60768dde0cdf6ebd8681029ec10
Closes-Bug: #1521899
'}]
commit_message:
Fix H405 violations

There are a lot of H405 violation codes.
We need to fix the code for avoiding more violations.

commit_message:
libvirt: fix TypeError in find_disk_dev_for_disk_bus

The NovaException class only takes the message and kwargs,
so we can't pass substitution variables into the __init__, else
we get a TypeError.

This was apparently untested so a unit test is added for
covering the error case.

Change-Id: If5090f30be8985c4a8e99139dc5be8bf93ce1d12
Partial-Bug: #1530847

commit_message:
Allow for usage of pre-allocated IPs for the controller nodes

This change adds a new *_from_pool.yaml meant to return an IP from
a list instead of allocating a Neutron port, useful to pick an IP
from a pre-defined list and making it possible to configure, for
example an external balancer in advance (or dns), with the future
IPs of the controller nodes.

The list of IPs is provided via parameter_defaults (in the
ControllerIPs struct) using ControllerIPs param.

Also some additional VipPort types are created for the *VirtualIP
resources. The VIPs were previously created using the same port
resource used by the nodes, but when deploying with an external
balancer we want the VIP resource to be nooped instead.

Change-Id: Id3d4f12235501ae77200430a2dc022f378dce336
(cherry picked from commit 22b4acf454d74302f1cca03f7fe22f63619b1f70)
Conflicts:
	network/ports/internal_api.yaml
	network/ports/storage.yaml
	network/ports/storage_mgmt.yaml
	network/ports/tenant.yaml

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if

enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong

commit_message:
Test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if
we use method CONF.set_override without parameter
enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True.

Change-Id: I1e4f2aa5797ba8582a5637cd86c6b2b626daa923
Closes-Bug: #1517839

subject: Fix broken nova-compute/nova-libvirt
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-05 15:51:00.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/nova/templates/nova.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Fix broken nova-compute/nova-libvirt

Currently the state of master has nova_compute unable to talk to
nova-libvirt. There have been some efforts to fix this, but they have
failed for various reasons. This puts the connection type for libvirt
from a socket to connecting to the already-open tcp connection thus
restoring the ability for nova-compute to talk to nova-libvirt and
function.

Change-Id: I5a6c39bb16159a2924a93a831e3c53cedd0ca7a1
Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-root
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken nova-compute/nova-libvirt

Currently the state of master has nova_compute unable to talk to
nova-libvirt. There have been some efforts to fix this, but they have
failed for various reasons. This puts the connection type for libvirt
from a socket to connecting to the already-open tcp connection thus
restoring the ability for nova-compute to talk to nova-libvirt and
function.

Change-Id: I5a6c39bb16159a2924a93a831e3c53cedd0ca7a1
Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-root

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-01-05 10:42:05.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/config.py'], 'message': "Fix API tests

Patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256164/
broke the Neutron API job by unsetting Tempest configuration
values that were unused by Tempest, but used by Neutron's fork
of Tempest. This patch copies credentials from the 'auth' section
to the 'identity' section.

The longer term plan is detailed here:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-tempest-defork
TL;DR: Removed overlap of tests between the Tempest and Neutron
repos, then use Tempest's plugin architecture for the tests that
will remain in the Neutron repo.

Change-Id: Ieb396cfd17f9cb66776ead11e7f760c1c26a0b08
"}]
commit_message:
Fix API tests

Patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256164/
broke the Neutron API job by unsetting Tempest configuration
values that were unused by Tempest, but used by Neutron's fork
of Tempest. This patch copies credentials from the 'auth' section
to the 'identity' section.

The longer term plan is detailed here:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-tempest-defork
TL;DR: Removed overlap of tests between the Tempest and Neutron
repos, then use Tempest's plugin architecture for the tests that
will remain in the Neutron repo.

Change-Id: Ieb396cfd17f9cb66776ead11e7f760c1c26a0b08

commit_message:
Update ceilometer proxy template

Now for using Ceilometer notifications from Swift we should
use Ceilometer middleware. Hence we need update template for Swift
to account for incoming and outgoing traffic notifications.

[1] I686e5d94fb72fd2a00973c91673edc417142ee2f
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/transport.html#oslo_messaging.TransportURL

Change-Id: Ib6efd4a1ab4b76c74cffc546383f5382c24a8c43
Related-bug: #1510064

subject: Wrap raw iterators to ensure we send entire contents to server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-30 20:05:03.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_swiftclient.py', 'swiftclient/utils.py', 'swiftclient/client.py'], 'message': "Wrap raw iterators to ensure we send entire contents to server

Currently, if you attempt to stream an upload from an iterator, as in

    def data():
        yield 'foo'
        yield ''
        yield 'bar'
    conn.put_object('c', 'o', data())

... requests will faithfully emit a zero-length chunk, ending the
transfer. Swift will then close the connection, possibly (if Connection:
keep-alive was set) after attempting to parse the next chunk as a new
request.

Now, Swift will receive all of the bytes from the iterable, and any
zero-byte chunks will be ignored.

This will be fixed in requests [1], but not until an eventual 3.0.0
release.

[1] https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests/pull/2631

Change-Id: I19579ed7a0181ac3f488433e7c1839f7f7a040b8
"}]
commit_message:
Wrap raw iterators to ensure we send entire contents to server

Currently, if you attempt to stream an upload from an iterator, as in

    def data():
        yield 'foo'
        yield ''
        yield 'bar'
    conn.put_object('c', 'o', data())

... requests will faithfully emit a zero-length chunk, ending the
transfer. Swift will then close the connection, possibly (if Connection:
keep-alive was set) after attempting to parse the next chunk as a new
request.

Now, Swift will receive all of the bytes from the iterable, and any
zero-byte chunks will be ignored.

This will be fixed in requests [1], but not until an eventual 3.0.0
release.

[1] https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests/pull/2631

Change-Id: I19579ed7a0181ac3f488433e7c1839f7f7a040b8

The 'swiftinit' provider is a custom provider of the service type
that manages swift services using swift-init.

Use of the swiftinit service provider is optional, the default is
to use service providers specified in params file. This provider
also manages swift services starting at boot by adding or removing
a templated init or services file and making systemctl calls.
See README for more detail.

A wrapper defined type 'swift::service' has been created to simplify
use of the swiftinit provider without adding logic to every class.
this wrapper also aids in input validation and testing of the
swiftinit provider.

Two extra runs of apply_manifest have been added to the
basic_swift_spec acceptance test. The service_provider
is set to "swiftinit".  The first run catches any errors upgrading
to the swiftinit service provider and the second run tests
idempotency.

This patch is an initial step towards using swift-init to manage
multiple swift services out of different configuration files such
as is needed to run a separate replication network.

Change-Id: I2f71c82c7a6c463f8c76a193409c0a17daa15bda
'}]
commit_message:
Manage swift with swiftinit service provider

The 'swiftinit' provider is a custom provider of the service type
that manages swift services using swift-init.

Use of the swiftinit service provider is optional, the default is
to use service providers specified in params file. This provider
also manages swift services starting at boot by adding or removing
a templated init or services file and making systemctl calls.
See README for more detail.

A wrapper defined type 'swift::service' has been created to simplify
use of the swiftinit provider without adding logic to every class.
this wrapper also aids in input validation and testing of the
swiftinit provider.

Two extra runs of apply_manifest have been added to the
basic_swift_spec acceptance test. The service_provider
is set to "swiftinit".  The first run catches any errors upgrading
to the swiftinit service provider and the second run tests
idempotency.

This patch is an initial step towards using swift-init to manage
multiple swift services out of different configuration files such
as is needed to run a separate replication network.

Change-Id: I2f71c82c7a6c463f8c76a193409c0a17daa15bda

commit_message:
Add lock to host-state consumption

This patch adds an instance-wide host-state lock to
`HostState.consume_from_spec` to make the consumption process atomic
accross green threads. The according tests are added to make sure the
lock is there when calling consume_from_spec.

The following patches will check the resources when doing a claim of
resources.

Change-Id: I19dc61f929d6beb761e2ede5a2712f7004cce789
Partially-Implements: blueprint host-state-level-locking

A scheduler host state instance contains caches of a compute node, its
service, aggregates and instances. Their updating logics are collected
together and then added an intra-process lock to make them atomic in
this patch. The lock is added per host state, in order to reduce the
unecessary blocks to the minimum. The according tests are added to make

Partially-Implements: blueprint host-state-level-locking

commit_message:
Add lock to scheduler host state updating

A scheduler host state instance contains caches of a compute node, its
service, aggregates and instances. Their updating logics are collected
together and then added an intra-process lock to make them atomic in
this patch. The lock is added per host state, in order to reduce the
unecessary blocks to the minimum. The according tests are added to make
sure the locks are set when doing updates.

The next patch will add another lock to host state consuming.

Change-Id: I8f15b1fd4c6c5f59f8e6ed0ee0d87aff45ee8ddd
Partially-Implements: blueprint host-state-level-locking

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-12-21 10:56:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': "Change logging level for 'oslo_db'

Currently, running a command such as 'nova-manage' produces a lot of
irrelevant debug messages from the 'oslo_db' module. For example:

  $ nova-manage vm list
  instance   node            type       state      launched ...
  2015-10-29 15:20:32.624 DEBUG oslo_db.api [req-0fc5d653-a78f-44...
  ...
  test1      nova-dev        m1.tiny    active     2015-10-29 ...

Change the default logging level for this module to ensure this output
is not shown.

Change-Id: I85d4f18b7d32d9e2cbac22e075c435b7c84e7020
Closes-bug: #1343697
"}]
commit_message:
Change logging level for 'oslo_db'

Currently, running a command such as 'nova-manage' produces a lot of
irrelevant debug messages from the 'oslo_db' module. For example:

  $ nova-manage vm list
  instance   node            type       state      launched ...
  2015-10-29 15:20:32.624 DEBUG oslo_db.api [req-0fc5d653-a78f-44...
  ...
  test1      nova-dev        m1.tiny    active     2015-10-29 ...

Change the default logging level for this module to ensure this output
is not shown.

Change-Id: I85d4f18b7d32d9e2cbac22e075c435b7c84e7020
Closes-bug: #1343697

commit_message:
Support of PyMySQL driver for MySQL backend

Add ability to use python-pymysql library
as backend for MySQL connections.
Update acceptance tests to use pyMySQL.
Docs: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation
The same implementation as it's done for keystone:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242134/

Change-Id: Ibc5b9717d681d9a090777d4fe64b906c3c07ec5d

commit_message:
Make Consumer an oslo_service

This makes more sense and also suppresses the error messages when
launching the service returned from oslo_messaing.get_rpc_server
service.  Instead of that service wait() being called, the Consumer's
wait will be called.

Change-Id: I63816e92fbe26a4213946e6ab584531bdc3b7dd2
Closes-Bug: #1527418

commit_message:
Misspelling in message

Misspelling "separated" in the message :
"A list of backend names seperated by comma ."

"Python 3.3 support is being dropped since OpenStack Liberty."
written in following URL.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

And already the infra team and the oslo team are dropping py33
support from their projects.

Since we rely on oslo for a lot of our work, and depend on infra

commit_message:
Drop py33 support

"Python 3.3 support is being dropped since OpenStack Liberty."
written in following URL.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

And already the infra team and the oslo team are dropping py33
support from their projects.

Since we rely on oslo for a lot of our work, and depend on infra
for our CI, we should drop py33 support too.

Change-Id: I37a08fc005ec78031e582721a5e472348ee5324c
Closes-Bug: #1526170

commit_message:
Support of PyMySQL driver for MySQL backend

Add ability to use python-pymysql library
as backend for MySQL connections.
Update acceptance tests to use pyMySQL.
Docs: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation
The same implementation as it's done for keystone:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242134/

Change-Id: Id279377b191363b665e22a86f117410a6f7b480c

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: I3a057080b7b888b2c246ad9910ddba564b07dbd9
Closes-Bug: #1530742

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-01-05 21:12:54.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "Switch default keystone auth_uri to v3

NOTE: we keep the inspector (client) auth URLs at v2.0 until it
properly handles v3 support. See LP bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-inspector/+bug/1531236

This change should allow keystone v3 as a default in most cases.
Our goal is to move towards using a versionless keystone auth_uri but
some clients still don't support that yet either so for now we hard
code to /v3 (similar to v2.0).

Change-Id: I55518994bcea1c1b9067912baf32919b692fb0c2
"}]
commit_message:
Switch default keystone auth_uri to v3

NOTE: we keep the inspector (client) auth URLs at v2.0 until it
properly handles v3 support. See LP bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-inspector/+bug/1531236

This change should allow keystone v3 as a default in most cases.
Our goal is to move towards using a versionless keystone auth_uri but
some clients still don't support that yet either so for now we hard
code to /v3 (similar to v2.0).

Change-Id: I55518994bcea1c1b9067912baf32919b692fb0c2

subject: fwaas config needs to notify l3 agent service
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-05 14:16:20.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_services_fwaas_spec.rb', 'manifests/services/fwaas.pp'], 'message': 'fwaas config needs to notify l3 agent service

This patch:
* make sure each modification to fwaas configuration will notify l3
  agent service.
* will write the configuration *before* trying to start l3 agent
  service. Without doing that, l3 agent would start without fwaas
  enabled.

Change-Id: Ib5c0d01726a2b56c4f0be9879add7b3c9d6038cc
(cherry picked from commit 0e041d4b694840b5bf99c09d7fef2f9b7a97d0ff)
'}]
commit_message:
fwaas config needs to notify l3 agent service

This patch:
* make sure each modification to fwaas configuration will notify l3
  agent service.
* will write the configuration *before* trying to start l3 agent
  service. Without doing that, l3 agent would start without fwaas
  enabled.

Change-Id: Ib5c0d01726a2b56c4f0be9879add7b3c9d6038cc
(cherry picked from commit 0e041d4b694840b5bf99c09d7fef2f9b7a97d0ff)

subject: deprecate mongodb_replica_set parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-23 10:54:49.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/ceilometer_db_spec.rb', 'manifests/db.pp'], 'message': 'deprecate mongodb_replica_set parameter

mongodb_replica_set parameter has been dropped in Mitaka [1] and has no
effect anymore.
This patch deprecated our interface by sending a warning if the param is
set. If set, it has no effect though, since the param does not exist
anymore upstream.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/commit/a6d608a33235dfa0d4ef91e3a3d69359ceb0263f

Closes-Bug: #1528612
Change-Id: I49123b0f1353e24b217ea6f16f556ab25a6c86b0
'}]
commit_message:
deprecate mongodb_replica_set parameter

mongodb_replica_set parameter has been dropped in Mitaka [1] and has no
effect anymore.
This patch deprecated our interface by sending a warning if the param is
set. If set, it has no effect though, since the param does not exist
anymore upstream.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/commit/a6d608a33235dfa0d4ef91e3a3d69359ceb0263f

Closes-Bug: #1528612
Change-Id: I49123b0f1353e24b217ea6f16f556ab25a6c86b0

commit_message:
swift-ring-builder 2.2.2+ output parse fix

Starting in swift 2.2.2 an extra line for overload is printed
by swift-ring-builder.
Check for this and skip that line to avoid avoid warning messages.

Change-Id: I2d81db0a29249101116c1899565f024aaac69000
Closes-Bug: #1524936
(cherry picked from commit 1dfe3d29a9d2850a23630c317db2c1c68412a015)

commit_message:
remove /v1.1 from default paste.ini

We stopped talking about /v1.1 nearly 3 years ago, it's in no
documentation. It should not be in our default deployed paste.ini as
it will only confuse folks.

subject: Bug fix: Cinder v2 returns bools now
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-01-05 20:11:29.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test__utils.py', 'shade/_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/cinderv2-norm-fix-037189c60b43089f.yaml'], 'message': 'Bug fix: Cinder v2 returns bools now

Cinder v1 used to return strings for some boolean values in the
volume dict. Cinder v2 uses bools. Fix the volume normalization
function to recognize either, and add unit tests for it.

Change-Id: Ia8600f660d0608622d0bface25f0d1418e6972cb
'}]
commit_message:
Bug fix: Cinder v2 returns bools now

Cinder v1 used to return strings for some boolean values in the
volume dict. Cinder v2 uses bools. Fix the volume normalization
function to recognize either, and add unit tests for it.

Change-Id: Ia8600f660d0608622d0bface25f0d1418e6972cb

commit_message:
Nodepool: Identify public internap network

This uses a new feature just added to our running nodepool that
allows us to identify which network is public so that nodepool
knows how to find a public ip address for servers.

subject: Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-04 02:17:21.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/executor.py'], 'message': 'Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Closes-Bug: #1530742
Change-Id: I36e77a086872c87cf93ab62455379d845aaa11df
'}]
commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Closes-Bug: #1530742
Change-Id: I36e77a086872c87cf93ab62455379d845aaa11df

commit_message:
Delete only murano data from image metadata

Previously murano removed all properties from image metadata instead
of only delete 'murano_image_info' element. This patch fixes it.

Closes-Bug: #1530801

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-05 14:31:07.000000000', 'files': ['www/kilo/index.html', 'www/liberty/index.html', 'www/juno/index.html', 'www/index.html', 'www/templates/ops_and_admin_guides.tmpl'], 'message': '[www] Add versioning to networking guide

Add versioning to the networking guide as follows:

1) Remove the networking guide from the template that
   includes similar continuous-release guides.
2) Add the networking guide below the template to the
   index.html, liberty/index.html, kilo/index.html, and
   juno/index.html files using specific releases.
3) Move the <div> tags from the template to the index.html
   files.

Note: The juno/index.html file references the Kilo version
      of the networking guide.

Change-Id: Ib3465beb3969fb1411e43286794f40695a3768ce
'}]
commit_message:
[www] Add versioning to networking guide

Add versioning to the networking guide as follows:

1) Remove the networking guide from the template that
   includes similar continuous-release guides.
2) Add the networking guide below the template to the
   index.html, liberty/index.html, kilo/index.html, and
   juno/index.html files using specific releases.
3) Move the <div> tags from the template to the index.html
   files.

Note: The juno/index.html file references the Kilo version
      of the networking guide.

Change-Id: Ib3465beb3969fb1411e43286794f40695a3768ce

commit_message:
Disable the in tree EC2 API by default

As of Kilo the in tree EC2 API is marked as deprecated and should not be
enabled by default. This will solve the following issue when working
with the default values.

---snip---
Deprecated: The in tree EC2 API is deprecated as of Kilo release and may
be removed in a future release. The stackforge ec2-api project
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/stackforge/ec2-api/ is the target
replacement for this functionality.
---snap---

Change-Id: Ia6f1d8f9c7d700498b6441a6ba37fa25b2611ef8

commit_message:
Add The Four Opens

The project's stance on the Four Opens is currently in the wiki, which
isn't a great place for such an important piece of information. We
should make it a bit more official.

Change-Id: I96ccb0ef823aca95b1fd0e7c2e1be3207ad52d00

commit_message:
Add set microversion in base compute service client

Now Manager class will set the request microversion
on each service clients if they support microversion.

This commit provide a set method on base compute service client
so that Manager can set expected microversion on those.

As all compute service clients needs to provide support for
microversion, those will be derived from this base class.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions-testing-support

Change-Id: I9d6fa9654da7c922d9436d541ab363e92127b3e3

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248572/ yum_update.sh

(cherry picked from commit 8abee0148de563e9a5636fb0a5cd057036f7ab2c)

commit_message:
Add fixup for pcs order constraints after update to new templates

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248572/ yum_update.sh
sets the pcs constraints before restarting the cluster. However
after post-update pacemaker run, the previous constraint of
neutron-server...neutron-ovs-cleanup is re-added. Explicitly
remove this before the post-update restart of certain services

Change-Id: I84dd650dcc66ce3f48926cf369b7d691014c2254
(cherry picked from commit 8abee0148de563e9a5636fb0a5cd057036f7ab2c)

commit_message:
Add to_dict method to Resource class

Many clients have to_dict method in Resource class.
It is needed to get full info about resource.
So it would be nice to add to_dict method in
cinder client too.

Now openstack/common has graduated from oslo-incubator.
So we just modify it cinderclient.

Changes merged with this patch:
---------------------
apiclient/base.py
  ---add to_dict function in class Resource.
unit/test_base.py
  ---add unit test case.

change-Id: I81add424bcdd667ba271adb7d5b1ceb504120f93

subject: Properly display missing data in run graphs
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-12-22 22:53:34.000000000', 'files': ['app/js/services/projects.js', 'test/unit/controllers/home_spec.js', 'app/js/controllers/home.js'], 'message': 'Properly display missing data in run graphs

This commit fixes the display of missing run data on the run stat
graphs. Previously d3 would interpolate between any 2 consecutive
data points regardless if there were missing samples between them.
In an earlier commit we updated the rest api to return an empty list
for samples that have no data. This commit builds off of that and
treats those empty lists as 0 for all values in that timestamp.

Change-Id: I137e4cfa1f22aaf2d932aa3d3420ebd841abca43
'}]
commit_message:
Properly display missing data in run graphs

This commit fixes the display of missing run data on the run stat
graphs. Previously d3 would interpolate between any 2 consecutive
data points regardless if there were missing samples between them.
In an earlier commit we updated the rest api to return an empty list
for samples that have no data. This commit builds off of that and
treats those empty lists as 0 for all values in that timestamp.

Change-Id: I137e4cfa1f22aaf2d932aa3d3420ebd841abca43

subject: Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method in favor of warning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-29 05:17:55.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/common/httpclient.py'], 'message': 'Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method in favor of warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning, so we
prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: If47818a6ce8adb14bc275dc5a6b5ab4b9d189ff7
Closes-Bug: 1508442
'}]
commit_message:
Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method in favor of warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning, so we
prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: If47818a6ce8adb14bc275dc5a6b5ab4b9d189ff7
Closes-Bug: 1508442

commit_message:
Don't build images with rdo-release by default

Currently, even when building images for deploying upstream mitaka
via delorean packages, we install rdo-release, resulting in a deployed
mitaka cloud with repos configured for RDO kilo.

Change-Id: I238987c64f5e4dd125d7a50311c5931a11b41855

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-01-05 20:05:20.000000000', 'files': ['resolutions/20151211-bring-your-own-kernel.rst'], 'message': "Resolution about Image Uploads and Linux Kernels

It has become clear that it's time for the TC to make a clear statement
about our intent on the point of Images and Kernels.

As an Open Source project, we have gone out of our way to enable
productization and differentiation by our vendors. Our 3rd Party CI
system is massive and Open- and our pluggability is almost cripplingly
comprehensive.

To give up on interoperable image uploads simply because a vendor would
like to do one thing that a little bit different isn't just wrong, it would
be giving up the ENTIRE effort.

We take a stand on very few things. We should take a stand on this.

Change-Id: I41247052240eaec19a9002cbefc52297d0d14566
"}]
commit_message:
Resolution about Image Uploads and Linux Kernels

It has become clear that it's time for the TC to make a clear statement
about our intent on the point of Images and Kernels.

As an Open Source project, we have gone out of our way to enable
productization and differentiation by our vendors. Our 3rd Party CI
system is massive and Open- and our pluggability is almost cripplingly
comprehensive.

To give up on interoperable image uploads simply because a vendor would
like to do one thing that a little bit different isn't just wrong, it would
be giving up the ENTIRE effort.

We take a stand on very few things. We should take a stand on this.

Change-Id: I41247052240eaec19a9002cbefc52297d0d14566

subject: Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed with PBR
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 05:34:48.000000000', 'files': ['MANIFEST.in'], 'message': "Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed with PBR

Zaqar uses PBR already - as you can see setup.py:

 setuptools.setup(
     setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
     pbr=True)

PBR generates a sensible manifest from git files
and some standard files.
So, this removes the need for an explicit
‘MANIFEST.in’ file.

Change-Id: I6f3aa562345cb055fe7f1dae49dac3720222764f
ref: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/pbr/#what-it-does
"}]
commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed with PBR

Zaqar uses PBR already - as you can see setup.py:

 setuptools.setup(
     setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
     pbr=True)

PBR generates a sensible manifest from git files
and some standard files.
So, this removes the need for an explicit
‘MANIFEST.in’ file.

Change-Id: I6f3aa562345cb055fe7f1dae49dac3720222764f
ref: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/pbr/#what-it-does

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run
py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this
problem to happen.

Change-Id: Ieff7f3609299f4505d08eea93391162e3ae3c006
Closes-bug: #1489059

commit_message:
convert GlanceClientWrapper to endpoint

This makes GlanceClientWrapper work with endpoint url instead of the
host, port, ssl tuple. Removing the last place where the host, port,
ssl tuple leaks outside of initial initialization of api_servers.

Change-Id: I8d854c132ddb1908836ce35b17445e4270c03349

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-18 16:01:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/servicetype_db.py'], 'message': 'Force service provider relationships to load

A race condition was exposed in the LBaaS V2 db layer that was caused by a
hack to get around this issue.  The real issue is that since the
ProviderResourceAssociation is inserted independently, any models that were
created before this insert will not have their relationship with the
ProviderResourceAssocation loaded.  Using the session.expire_all method will
force the session to retrieve all new data and load this relationship for any
resource that uses this relationship.

Change-Id: I940b541f4ef9c489126cd2d215b1d857f0624de0
Closes-Bug: #1504465
(cherry picked from commit f218929bc5126466b2a79b56d32e9cf042aa176d)
'}]
commit_message:
Force service provider relationships to load

A race condition was exposed in the LBaaS V2 db layer that was caused by a
hack to get around this issue.  The real issue is that since the
ProviderResourceAssociation is inserted independently, any models that were
created before this insert will not have their relationship with the
ProviderResourceAssocation loaded.  Using the session.expire_all method will
force the session to retrieve all new data and load this relationship for any
resource that uses this relationship.

Change-Id: I940b541f4ef9c489126cd2d215b1d857f0624de0
Closes-Bug: #1504465
(cherry picked from commit f218929bc5126466b2a79b56d32e9cf042aa176d)

subject: Passes to os-cloud-config Keystone{Admin,Internal}Vip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-17 18:30:39.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Passes to os-cloud-config Keystone{Admin,Internal}Vip

The endpoint urls to use for Keystone need to reflect what we emit
from the templates. This change passes the correct values of those
VIPs to os-cloud-config so that we don't make any assumption or
coupling in between any of the Overcloud VIPs and the endpoint urls.

Change-Id: Ic555f01a78322ba17fb3233e2ea16ad8e2c9e017
Depends-On: I6d6ad06441514c6eca9922937dba9b521dad06db
"}]
commit_message:
Passes to os-cloud-config Keystone{Admin,Internal}Vip

The endpoint urls to use for Keystone need to reflect what we emit
from the templates. This change passes the correct values of those
VIPs to os-cloud-config so that we don't make any assumption or
coupling in between any of the Overcloud VIPs and the endpoint urls.

Change-Id: Ic555f01a78322ba17fb3233e2ea16ad8e2c9e017
Depends-On: I6d6ad06441514c6eca9922937dba9b521dad06db

subject: fix stable/liberty telemetry integration job
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-21 16:21:54.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ceilometer.yaml'], 'message': "fix stable/liberty telemetry integration job

devstack-gate sets up the environment for gate jobs but it
configures branches at a global level rather than a per project
level. this means projects which are released independently can't
be tested with other projects.

this patch skips the devstack-gate configuration of gnocchi and
lets devstack configure it so enable_plugin functionality is properly
handled.

Change-Id: I924f99ffb3344b2d501c53dbbc8403f419dfdee7
Closes-Bug: #1526530
"}]
commit_message:
fix stable/liberty telemetry integration job

devstack-gate sets up the environment for gate jobs but it
configures branches at a global level rather than a per project
level. this means projects which are released independently can't
be tested with other projects.

this patch skips the devstack-gate configuration of gnocchi and
lets devstack configure it so enable_plugin functionality is properly
handled.

Change-Id: I924f99ffb3344b2d501c53dbbc8403f419dfdee7
Closes-Bug: #1526530

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run py34 env before py27.
This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this
problem to happen.

Change-Id: I25d1bbd1abaafa4a443d36c9b68481891391ddf7
Closes-bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Set mount_check to True by default

In a previous release, we sent a deprecation warning for mount_check
parameter which was set to False by default, while upstream uses True.

This patch aims to use upstream default, True, by default in our
interface.

Depends-On: I0bb1ccf4c0adc4e217e2989bd50d96741fa156f7
Change-Id: I453e24509a3f05d1fea69d47577cf81535a1ee13

commit_message:
Unreference mocks are listed in the wrong order

There are a couple of policy checks where mocks are used to allow the
checks to complete. The mocks aren't referenced later. However they
are listed in the wrong order. While this doesn't impact this test
directly, it is confusing, and may confuse people down the road trying
to build tests based on this one.

Change-Id: Idd1da91fe8d8b1e20bef469ef67728610a9ac3c1
Closes-Bug: #1527881

commit_message:
Support migrating of legacy routers to HA and back

This patch adds support for migration of legacy routers to HA and
vice-versa. This patch also:

1. Reverts I4171ab481e3943e0110bd9a300d965bbebe44871, which was used to
   disable such migrations until support was inserted to the codebase.
2. Adds an exception to indicate that such migrations are only available
   on routers that have their admin_state_up set to False.

(cherry picked from commit 416c76bc6e01ef433506e4aa4ebd7c76b57acc51)

Closes-Bug: #1365426
DocImpact (Handled in patch 233695)
Change-Id: Ie92f8033f47e1bf9ba6310373b3bfc9833317580
Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py
	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py

commit_message:
Remove unused logging import and LOG global var

In some modules the global LOG is not used any more. And the import
of logging is not used. This patch removes the unused logging import
and LOG vars.

Change-Id: I28572c325f8c31ff38161010047bba00c5d5b833

commit_message:
Add 5 time measurement points

run_process           process starting time
test_with_retry       process starting time (for neutron legacy)
restart_apache_server Apache HTTPD restart time
wait_for_service      HTTP server waiting time
git_timed             git command execution time

example

========================
DevStack Components Timed
========================

run_process - 52 secs
test_with_retry - 3 secs
apt-get-update - 8 secs
pip_install - 76 secs
restart_apache_server - 9 secs
wait_for_service - 11 secs
git_timed - 127 secs
apt-get - 15 secs

Change-Id: I66140726617450cd9fe9b702092cacf053a20065

cause bashate to be run. Rather, it causes 'tox' to run the unit

Change-Id: I235ed7b20b45f2052f0ca0e9e4d96e379667b567

commit_message:
Remove bashate from envlist

This removes 'bashate' from the envlist in tox.ini because it doesn't
cause bashate to be run. Rather, it causes 'tox' to run the unit
tests :-(

'tox pep8' will invoke bashate.

Change-Id: I235ed7b20b45f2052f0ca0e9e4d96e379667b567

subject: Add security-guide/build to doc8 ignore-path
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-30 10:14:10.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add security-guide/build to doc8 ignore-path

After generating a document, when tox -e checkniceness is run
we will get an error:

security-guide/build/html/.buildinfo:2: D001 Line too long

There is no need to check files under security-guide/build.

Change-Id: Ifc32d206f2589f98f037ac389679f62b7c46ce01
'}]
commit_message:
Add security-guide/build to doc8 ignore-path

After generating a document, when tox -e checkniceness is run
we will get an error:

security-guide/build/html/.buildinfo:2: D001 Line too long

There is no need to check files under security-guide/build.

Change-Id: Ifc32d206f2589f98f037ac389679f62b7c46ce01

commit_message:
Preserve result returned by apt-get and pip

Change I855ffe9c7a75e9943106af0f70cf715c34ae25c5 and
I368fec44858bd97fc6a314fb20eed2b10932cbb1 added timing
infrastructure which hides the return value of
the main commands.  Restore the prior behaviour.

Change-Id: I4a536abefa7824ac6d42e7bbbf1079d9cc055984
Closes-Bug: #1518545

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-30 05:48:48.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/access/access.py', 'keystoneauth1/extras/_saml2/v3/adfs.py'], 'message': 'Wrong usage of "a"

Wrong usage of "a" in the messages:
"build a etree.XML object"
"Return a object representing the list"

Should be:
"build an etree.XML object"

commit_message:
Wrong usage of "a"

Wrong usage of "a" in the messages:
"build a etree.XML object"
"Return a object representing the list"

Should be:
"build an etree.XML object"
"Return an object representing the list"

Totally 2 occurrences in keystoneauth base code.

Change-Id: I0299e16d5340b4f062e119dc95a529b812f7606c

commit_message:
Introduce iniget_sections function

This function returns list of sections from specified INI file.
It is needed for I7938f26015d953efdf720774b5ad2cee4068ac90.
'iniget_sections' is needed for automatic node enrollment to
Ironic from INI syntax file.

Change-Id: I52a69ad3bc8fc528e7f20e6b03a98f327acaaa74
Implements: blueprint ironic-ml2-integration

subject: Move more nodes to devstack for infra-puppet-apply
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-04 14:41:27.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Move more nodes to devstack for infra-puppet-apply

In an effort to keep out gate jobs consistent, we should be using
devstack-precise and devstack-trusty. This also move us away from the
bare nodes, which will be removed in the future.

Change-Id: I89d42ca7d7a4d19f67e4b46c726fba3af5cc15ec
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Move more nodes to devstack for infra-puppet-apply

In an effort to keep out gate jobs consistent, we should be using
devstack-precise and devstack-trusty. This also move us away from the
bare nodes, which will be removed in the future.

Change-Id: I89d42ca7d7a4d19f67e4b46c726fba3af5cc15ec
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
